column3: Yes. Probably a good idea. It can always come back in node mode in case someone once adds an option to inspect the mempool or blocks, etc.\n\nConcept ACK
> Could also disable with -disablewallet?\n\nMany thanks for the hint. It now also disables the textbox when **-disablewallet**.
Is this change even necessary? I think the above `(!enableWallet)` change covers all cases where there's no wallet? if so, it's good to avoid introducing conditional compilation if possible.
I have tested it and yes, it doesn't need this #ifdef. Many thanks!
